titleStmt.title: Description of Center for Advanced Judaic Studies Library, Halper 15: Numbers 16:30-17:4, with Masorah magna and parva

publicationStmt.publisher: Center for Advanced Judaic Studies Library

notesStmt.note: Masorah magna is found in both the upper and lower margins; left rule is justified by a filler י or broken א, or ש; the closed parasha after XVI 35 is signified by a complete empty line. In the middle of XVI 32, between אותם\ ואת there are 8 open spaces marked by carats (^).
Condition: damaged on all edges; written area complete but slightly faded.

msIdentifier.repository: Center for Advanced Judaic Studies Library

msItem.title: Numbers 16:30-17:4, with Masorah magna and parva

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 1; lines: 12 + 2 upper, 2 lower (recto); 11 + 2 upper, 2 lower (verso).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Hebrew Oriental square vocalization and cantillation (Tiberian)

history.provenance: Cairo Genizah Collection (University of Pennsylvania. Center for Advanced Judaic Studies. Library).
